<P ID=PARA7851 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7852 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7853 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	At January 3, 2016, the Company had total net operating loss carry forwards of $80.2 million, of which $50.9 million, $24.5 million and $4.8 million pertains to federal loss carry forwards from U.S., Canadian and Asian jurisdictions respectively. $1.3 million will expire in 2017, $2.3 million will expire between 2018 and 2022, $17.9 million will expire in 2023, $10.1 million will expire between 2025 and 2029, $19.7 million will expire in 2030 and the remainder will expire beyond 2030.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7854 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7855 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	At January 3, 2016 and December 28, 2014, the Company had gross unrecognized tax benefits of $275 and $290, respectively, which if recognized, would favorably impact the Company&#8217;s effective tax rate in future periods. The Company does not expect any of these unrecognized tax benefits to reverse in the next twelve months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7856 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7857 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company accounts for interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits in income tax expense based on the likelihood of the event and its ability to reasonably estimate such amounts. The Company has approximately $58 and $55 accrued for interest and penalties as of January 3, 2016 and December 28, 2014, respectively. The decrease is due to the foreign exchange movement between the financial reporting currency and the functional currency for tax purposes, net of interest and penalty charges recorded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7858 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>

</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA7867 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7868 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7869 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Whether or not the recapitalization transactions undertaken in 2004 result in an ownership change for purposes of Section&nbsp;382 of the Internal Revenue Code (&#8220;Section 382&#8221;), which imposes a limitation on a corporation&#8217;s use of NOL carry forwards following an &#8220;ownership change,&#8221; depends upon whether the exchangeable shares of SMTC Canada are treated as shares of the Company under U.S. tax principles. The Company has concluded that the recapitalization transactions did not result in an ownership change and as such the use of the NOL carry forwards has not been limited.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7870 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7871 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In assessing the realization of deferred tax assets, management considers whether it is more likely than not that some portion or all of its U.S. deferred tax assets will not be realized. The ultimate realization of deferred tax assets is dependent upon the generation of future taxable income. Management considers the scheduled reversal of deferred tax liabilities, change of control limitations, projected future taxable income and tax planning strategies in making this assessment. Guidance under ASC 740, Income Taxes, (&#8220;ASC 740&#8221;) states that forming a conclusion that a valuation allowance is not needed is difficult when there is negative evidence, such as cumulative losses in recent years in the jurisdictions to which the deferred tax assets relate. In 2013, it was determined by management that a partial valuation allowance was required to be recorded against certain deferred tax assets associated with the U.S. jurisdiction as it was not more likely than not to be realized. In 2014, it was determined by management that a full valuation allowance was required to be recorded against the remaining deferred tax assets associated with the U.S. jurisdiction as it was not likely to be realized. The Canadian jurisdiction continues to have a full valuation allowance recorded against the deferred tax assets. In 2015, management has concluded that a full valuation allowance is still required to be recorded against the Canadian, Asian and U.S jurisdiction deferred tax assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7872 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA7872 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK7875 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR7875 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM7875 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	73
</DIV>

</P>

<P ID=PARA7966 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7967 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	General description
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7968 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7969 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 31.5PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company is operated and managed geographically and has production facilities in the United States, Mexico and China. The Company utilizes reportable segment&#8217;s site contribution (site revenues minus operating expenses, excluding unrealized foreign exchange on unsettled forward foreign exchange contracts, corporate allocations and restructuring expenses) to monitor reportable segment performance. Site contribution is utilized by the chief operating decision-maker as the indicator of reportable segment performance, as it reflects costs which our operating site management is directly responsible for. In assessing the performance of the reportable segments, management attributes site revenue to the reportable segment that ships the product to the customer, irrespective of the product&#8217;s destination. Information about the reportable segments is as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7970 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7971 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 31.5PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Year

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
<I>
	Geographic revenues:
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<P ID=PARA8768 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8769 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Significant customers and concentration of credit risk
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8770 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8771 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Sales of the Company&#8217;s products are concentrated among specific customers in the same industry. The Company requires collateral only from new customers with insufficient credit until such time as credit insurance can be obtained. The Company is subject to concentrations of credit risk in trade receivables and mitigates this risk through ongoing credit evaluation of customers and the carriage of credit insurance. The Company considers concentrations of credit risk in establishing the allowance for doubtful accounts and believes the recorded allowances are adequate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8772 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8773 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company expects to continue to depend upon a relatively small number of customers for a significant percentage of its revenue. In addition to having a limited number of customers, the Company manufactures a limited number of products for each customer. If the Company loses any of its largest customers or any product line manufactured for one of its largest customers, it could experience a significant reduction in revenue. Also, the insolvency of one or more of its largest customers or the inability of one or more of its largest customers to pay for its orders could decrease future revenue. As many costs and operating expenses are relatively fixed, a reduction in net revenue can decrease profit margins and adversely affect business, financial condition and results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8774 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8775 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	During the period ended January 3, 2016, two customers individually comprised 13% and 11% of revenue from across all geographic segments. At January 3, 2016, these customers represented 8% and 4% of the Company&#8217;s trade accounts receivable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8776 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8777 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	During the period ended December 28, 2014 three customers individually comprised 31%, 12% and 10% of revenue from across all geographic segments. At December 28, 2014, these customers represented 21%, 12% and 3% of the Company&#8217;s trade accounts receivable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8778 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8779 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	During the period ended December 29, 2013 two customers individually comprised 36%, and 12% of revenue from across all geographic segments. At December 29, 2013, these customers represented 22%, and 18% of the Company&#8217;s trade accounts receivable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8780 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P ID=PARA5.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<TABLE ID=TBL8823 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 3%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA8821 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	1
</B>
<B>
	1
</B>
<B>
	.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 97%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA8822 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Commitments and contingencies cont&#8217;d
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P ID=PARA8824 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8825 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Delaware General Corporation Law allows a corporation to eliminate the personal liability of directors to the corporation or to any of its stockholders for monetary damages for a breach of his fiduciary duty as a director, except in the case where the director breached his duty of loyalty, failed to act in good faith, engaged in intentional misconduct or knowingly violated a law, authorized the payment of a dividend or approved a stock repurchase in violation of Delaware corporate law or obtained an improper personal benefit. The Company has entered into indemnification agreements with each director which provide that the Company shall, subject to certain exceptions, indemnify and pay, advance or reimburse the costs of defense of such person who is made party to a proceeding by reason of their indemnified capacities. Each indemnified party agrees to repay any payment, advance or reimbursement of expenses made by the Company to such person if it is determined, following the final disposition of the claim, that the person is not entitled to indemnification by the Company with respect to a claim for which indemnification was obtained.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8826 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8827 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The nature of the indemnification prevents the Company from making a reasonable estimate of the maximum potential amount it could be required to pay to counterparties. The Company has purchased directors&#8217; and officers&#8217; liability insurance. No amount has been accrued in the consolidated balance sheet as at January 3, 2016 with respect to this indemnity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P ID=PARA8829 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Operating lease expense for the periods ended January 3, 2016, December 28, 2014 and December 29, 2013 was $2,358, $2,175 and $2,330, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8830 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8831 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Certain of the Company&#8217;s facility leases include renewal options and normal escalation clauses. Renewal options are included in the lease term if reasonably assured. Escalation clauses are accounted for on a straight-line basis over the lease term.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8832 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8833 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Purchase Obligations
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8834 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8835 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Purchase obligations not recorded on the balance sheet as at January 3, 2016 consist of insurance installments of $218 to be paid during 2016. Purchase obligations not recorded on the balance sheet as at December 28, 2014 consist of insurance installments of $231 paid during 2015. As at December 29, 2013, purchase obligations not recorded on the balance sheet consist of insurance installments of $254 that were paid during 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8836 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8837 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Purchase obligations not recorded on the balance sheet as at January 3, 2016 consist of open non-cancellable purchase orders for raw materials for $13,215 to be paid during calendar year 2016. Purchase obligations not recorded on the balance sheet as at December 28, 2014 consist of open purchase orders for raw materials for $12,043 to be paid during calendar year 2015. Purchase obligations not recorded on the balance sheet as at December 29, 2013 consist of open purchase orders for raw materials for $37,540 to be paid during calendar year 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8838 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8839 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<I>
	Contingencies
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8840 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8841 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 24.45PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In the normal course of business, the Company may be subject to litigation and claims from customers, suppliers and former employees. Management believes that adequate provisions have been recorded in the accounts, where required. Although it is not possible to estimate the extent of potential costs, if any, management believes that the ultimate resolution of such contingencies would not have a material adverse effect on the financial position, results of operations and cash flows of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8842 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P ID=PARA8847 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8848 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 22.5PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company has a 401K Plan which is accounted for as a defined contribution plan for certain U.S. employees, whereby the Company matches a portion of employee contributions. Company contributions to the plan were $157, $104 and $408 for the years ended January 3, 2016, December 28, 2014 and December 29, 2013, respectively. &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8849 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8850 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT 0PT 0PT 22.5PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company has certain post-employment benefits related to employees in its Mexico facility. These benefit plans are only available to local employees and are generally government mandated. The liability related to the unfunded benefit obligations was $268 and $298 as at January 3, 2016 and December 28, 2014 respectively, which was classified within accrued liabilities in the consolidated balance sheet.
</FONT>
</P>

<P ID=PARA2 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<B>
	SECTION 302 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">

<P ID=PARA7 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	I, Sushil Dhiman, certify that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA10 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE ID=MTAB11 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA12 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 24PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">

	2.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<P ID=PARA18 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_3"></A>
<P ID=PARA2 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA4 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	SECTION 1350, CHAPTER 63 OF TITLE 18, UNITED STATES CODE,
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA5 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA6 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;1350, Chapter 63 of Title 18, United States Code, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the undersigned, as chief executive officer of SMTC Corporation (the &#8220;Company&#8221;), does hereby certify that to the undersigned&#8217;s knowledge:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA10 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA9 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	1) the Company&#8217;s annual report on Form 10-K for the fiscal period ended January 3, 2016 fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA12 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA11 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	2) the information contained in the Company&#8217;s annual report on Form 10-K for the fiscal period ended January 3, 2016 fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA13 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">

<P ID=PARA20 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">

<B>

</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA8 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Pursuant to Section&nbsp;1350, Chapter 63 of Title 18, United States Code, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, the undersigned, as principal financial officer of SMTC Corporation (the &#8220;Company&#8221;), does hereby certify that to the undersigned&#8217;s knowledge:
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA10 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA9 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	1) the Company&#8217;s annual report on Form 10-K for the fiscal period ended January 3, 2016 fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA12 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA11 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	2) the information contained in the Company&#8217;s annual report on Form 10-K for the fiscal period ended January 3, 2016 fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
